summary: "Nighthawks" is a famous painting by Edward Hopper, showing four people in a late-night diner. The diner is bright, while outside, the city is dark and empty. It's one of the most well-known American paintings, part of the American Realism style. Painted in 1942, it was sold for $3,000 to the Art Institute of Chicago soon after.
title: Nighthawks (Hopper)
